main event: On 22 March 1957, an object was sighted in Dayton, Ohio, which was concluded to possibly be a weather balloon.
interesting points: The object was reported as stationary during the observation., The sighting coincided with the release of weather balloons from Sulphur Grove., The report suggested various possibilities including balloon and astronomical causes., The text indicated that there was insufficient data for full evaluation., A letter from a newspaper editor in St. Marys was included, asking about the sighting.
sighted object: One object, possibly a weather balloon
witness description: Civilian reports and media inquiries were the source of information.
